Dynamical study of Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT systems at a chiral quark model

Abstract

Since the discovery of Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by LHCb, there has been considerable interest in Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and its heavy-flavor partners. However, the study of its strange partner Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has been largely overlooked. Within the framework of the chiral quark model, we conducted a systematic study of the bound states of Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT utilizing the Gaussian Expansion Method. Considering all physical channels with 01+superscript0101^{+}01 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, including molecular and diquark structures. Our calculations revealed that upon considering the coupling between diquarks and molecular states, we identified a deep bound state with a bounding energy of 60 MeV, primarily composed of K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Using the P03superscriptsubscript𝑃03{}^{3}P_{0}start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT model, we calculated the decay width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT within the K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bound state, which is approximated as the decay width of the bound state in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system. The results indicate that due to the effect of binding energy, the decay width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is approximately 3333 MeV smaller than that of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in vacuum. Additionally, resonance state calculations were performed. Utilizing the real-scaling method, we searched for possible resonance states in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sysytem. Due to the strong attraction in the [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT configuration, four resonance states were found in the vicinity of 2.22.22.22.2-2.82.82.82.8 GeV, predominantly featuring hidden-color structures, and their decay widths are all less than 10101010 MeV. We strongly recommend experimental efforts to search for the resonance states in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system predicted by our calculations.

I Introduction

In 1964, Gell-Mann Gell-Mann:1964ewy and Zweig Zweig:1964jf proposed the conventional quark model, suggesting that mesons and baryons are composed of q⁢q¯𝑞¯𝑞q\bar{q}italic_q over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG and q⁢q⁢q𝑞𝑞𝑞qqqitalic_q italic_q italic_q, respectively. At that time, by utilizing this model, most of the hadrons were explained well. Over the past two decades, however, there has been an influx of new experimental data unveiling properties of hadronic states that challenge the predictions of the conventional quark model, such as X⁢(3872)𝑋3872X(3872)italic_X ( 3872 ) Belle:2003nnu , Y⁢(4626)𝑌4626Y(4626)italic_Y ( 4626 ) Belle:2019qoi , Zc⁢(3900)subscript𝑍𝑐3900Z_{c}(3900)italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 3900 ) BESIII:2013ris and so on. These exotic hadronic states provide a valuable platform for a deeper understanding of the properties of low-lying Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD).

In 2021, LHCb Collaboration reported a new state Tc⁢c+⁢(3875)superscriptsubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐3875T_{cc}^{+}(3875)italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 3875 ) in the D0⁢D0⁢πsuperscript𝐷0superscript𝐷0𝜋D^{0}D^{0}\piitalic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π mass distribution with a mass M=3875.1+δ⁢me⁢x⁢p𝑀3875.1𝛿subscript𝑚𝑒𝑥𝑝M=3875.1+\delta m_{exp}italic_M = 3875.1 + italic_δ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e italic_x italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where δ⁢me⁢x⁢p=−273±61±5−14+11𝛿subscript𝑚𝑒𝑥𝑝plus-or-minus27361subscriptsuperscript51114\delta m_{exp}=-273\pm 61\pm 5^{+11}_{-14}italic_δ italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e italic_x italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - 273 ± 61 ± 5 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 11 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 14 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT keV, and a width Γ=410±165±43−38+18Γplus-or-minus410165subscriptsuperscript431838\Gamma=410\pm 165\pm 43^{+18}_{-38}roman_Γ = 410 ± 165 ± 43 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 18 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 38 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT keV LHCb:2021auc ; LHCb:2021vvq . The very narrow width indicates that it is a long-living exotic state. Its spin-parity quantum number is JP=1+superscript𝐽𝑃superscript1J^{P}=1^{+}italic_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. These interesting properties have attracted widespread theoretical attentions and researches  Collins:2024sfi ; Ikeda:2013vwa ; Junnarkar:2018twb ; Du:2021zzh ; Meng:2021jnw ; Tan:2024pqs ; Wang:2022clw ; Lu:2020rog ; Meng:2020knc ; Chen:2021vhg ; Ebert:2007rn ; Feijoo:2021ppq ; Yan:2021wdl ; Dong:2021bvy ; Huang:2021urd ; Fleming:2021wmk ; Braaten:2022elw ; Hu:2021gdg ; Chen:2021cfl ; Deng:2021gnb ; Wang:2022jop ; Ling:2021bir ; Ke:2021rxd ; Agaev:2022ast ; Braaten:2020nwp ; Karliner:2021wju ; He:2022rta ; Abreu:2022lfy ; Agaev:2021vur ; Azizi:2021aib ; Vijande:2009kj ; Navarra:2007yw ; Yang:2009zzp ; Tan:2020ldi ; Achasov:2022onn ; Lyu:2023xro ; Li:2012ss ; Cheng:2020wxa ; Lin:2023gzm ; Chen:2013aba ; Wang:2020jgb . While Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT partners involving heavy quarks have been extensively studied, limited attention has been given to double strangeness partners (Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) tetraquark states. The structure of the paper is as follows: Section II provides a brief description of the quark model and wave functions. Section III introduces the real-scaling method. Section IV details the P03superscriptsubscript𝑃03{}^{3}P_{0}start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT method. Section V presents our results and discussion.

II Chiral quark model, wave function of Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system

II.1 Chiral quark model

In this paper, we primarily investigate the dynamics of the s⁢q¯⁢s⁢q¯𝑠¯𝑞𝑠¯𝑞s\bar{q}s\bar{q}italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG system using the chiral quark model. This model is an excellent potential framework as it effectively explains hadron interactions, including mass terms, kinetic terms, and potential terms, which can be written as

One of the characteristics of QCD is quark confinement, which suggests that quarks cannot be separated. This corresponds to the confinement potential in the Hamiltonian. Unlike other potential forms in the quark model, the confinement potential is not directly derived from field theory. Consequently, it typically appears in three common forms: linear confinement potential Yang:2017prf , quadratic confinement potential Tan:2024omp , and screened confinement potential Vijande:2004he . These potentials share a common feature of exhibiting strong attraction at short distances. The distinction lies in the fact that due to the screening effects, screened confinement potential can describe well the spectra of light mesons including excited states. Given that the s⁢q¯⁢s⁢q¯𝑠¯𝑞𝑠¯𝑞s\bar{q}s\bar{q}italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG system involves light mesons (K𝐾Kitalic_K/K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT), we employ the screened confinement potential in this study. Its specific form is given as follows:

Vc⁢o⁢n⁢(ri⁢j)subscript𝑉𝑐𝑜𝑛subscript𝑟𝑖𝑗\displaystyle V_{con}(r_{ij})italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_o italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =[−ac⁢(1−e−μc⁢ri⁢j)+Δ]⁢𝝀ic⋅𝝀jc,absent⋅delimited-[]subscript𝑎𝑐1superscript𝑒subscript𝜇𝑐subscript𝑟𝑖𝑗Δsuperscriptsubscript𝝀𝑖𝑐superscriptsubscript𝝀𝑗𝑐\displaystyle=[-a_{c}(1-e^{-\mu_{c}r_{ij}})+\Delta]\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{i}^{c% }\cdot\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{j}^{c},= [ - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + roman_Δ ] bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋅ bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , (6)

where 𝝀csuperscript𝝀𝑐\boldsymbol{\lambda}^{c}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are S⁢U⁢(3)𝑆𝑈3SU(3)italic_S italic_U ( 3 ) color Gell-Mann matrices, acsubscript𝑎𝑐a_{c}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, μcsubscript𝜇𝑐\mu_{c}italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are model parameters.

The one-gluon exchange potential Vo⁢g⁢e⁢(ri⁢j)subscript𝑉𝑜𝑔𝑒subscript𝑟𝑖𝑗V_{oge}(r_{ij})italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_g italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) reflects the QCD characteristic of asymptotic freedom, and plays a crucial role in the quark model by offering intermediate-range attractive forces. This potential generally consists of a coulomb term and a color-magnetic term. It reads

where αssubscript𝛼𝑠\alpha_{s}italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the QCD-inspired strong coupling constant, which is is determined by fitting experimental meson data. Generally, the heavier the quark, the smaller the coupling constant between quarks. All the parameters are determined by fitting the meson spectrum, from light to heavy, taking into account only a quark-antiquark component. They are shown in Table 1.

II.2 The wave function of Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system

The Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system has two important structures: the molecular configuration (s⁢q¯𝑠¯𝑞s\bar{q}italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG-s⁢q¯𝑠¯𝑞s\bar{q}italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG) and the diquark configuration (s⁢s𝑠𝑠ssitalic_s italic_s-q¯⁢q¯¯𝑞¯𝑞\bar{q}\bar{q}over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG). At the quark level, these are expressed as the product of four components: color, spin, flavor, and orbital parts. According to QCD, any quark system, including multi-quark states, must be colorless. Therefore, the color wave function of a four-quark system can be obtained by either two coupled color-singlet clusters, 𝟏⊗𝟏tensor-product11\mathbf{1}\otimes\mathbf{1}bold_1 ⊗ bold_1,

III Real-scaling method

The real-scaling method was first proposed by Taylor Taylor:1970 to study resonance states in electron-molecule systems. Due to its success in explaining a substantial amount of experimental data, Hiyama et al. Hiyama:2018ukv applied this method at the quark level to search for the Pcsubscript𝑃𝑐P_{c}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT states in the q⁢q⁢q⁢c⁢c¯𝑞𝑞𝑞𝑐¯𝑐qqqc\bar{c}italic_q italic_q italic_q italic_c over¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG system. Subsequently, we introduced this method to the tetraquark system for the first time and successfully explained particles Tan:2019knr ; Tan:2020cpu ; Tan:2022pzi ; Tan:2023azs ; Wu:2023hhk such as Y⁢(4626)𝑌4626Y(4626)italic_Y ( 4626 ), X⁢(2900)𝑋2900X(2900)italic_X ( 2900 ), and Υ⁢(10753)Υ10753\Upsilon(10753)roman_Υ ( 10753 ).

The real-scaling method involves systematically scaling the width of Gaussian functions between two groups using a scaling factor, denoted as α𝛼\alphaitalic_α, R→α⁢R→𝑅𝛼𝑅R\rightarrow\alpha Ritalic_R → italic_α italic_R. As α𝛼\alphaitalic_α increases, the width of the Gaussian functions expands, leading to variations in the energy of system. If a stable structure is present, it remains unaffected by the changes in Gaussian function widths. Within the framework of this method, bound states do not exhibit decay behavior due to the absence of corresponding decay channels, and thus manifest as horizontal lines, shown in FIG. 1(a). Conversely, resonance states, having several decay channels, strongly couple with scattering channels and decay to the relevant threshold channels. This is depicted in FIG. 1(b) by two downward-sloping lines that demonstrate avoided crossing behavior. Since resonance states are stable structures, the avoid-crossing structure may reappear as the scaling factor α𝛼\alphaitalic_α increases. However, a larger α𝛼\alphaitalic_α results in a more complex calculation process. Therefore, for computational efficiency, we chose the range of α𝛼\alphaitalic_α to be between 1.01.01.01.0 and 3.03.03.03.0. Within this range, most resonance states will exhibit repeated avoid-crossing structures. The real-scaling method allows for the calculation of the decay width of stable states. The calculation equation is as follows,

Γ=4⁢|V⁢(αc)|⁢|S⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢er|⁢|S⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢es||S⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢er−S⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢es|.Γ4𝑉subscript𝛼𝑐𝑆𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑟𝑆𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑠𝑆𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑟𝑆𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑠\Gamma=4|V(\alpha_{c})|\frac{\sqrt{|Slope_{r}||Slope_{s}|}}{|Slope_{r}-Slope_{% s}|}.roman_Γ = 4 | italic_V ( italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG | italic_S italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | italic_S italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG | italic_S italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_S italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | end_ARG . (21)

Based on the discussion above, in the framework of real-scaling method, avoided-crossing structure represents resonant state, while horizontal line indicates bound state. Therefore, the decay width calculation Eq. 21 is applicable only to the decay width of resonant states. The ”s⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢er𝑠𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑟slope_{r}italic_s italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT” and ”s⁢l⁢o⁢p⁢es𝑠𝑙𝑜𝑝subscript𝑒𝑠slope_{s}italic_s italic_l italic_o italic_p italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT” indicate the slope of these two lines.

V Results and discussions

In this section, we systematically studied the bound and resonant states in Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We coupled the diquark and molecular structures to explore potential bound states, K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Within the framework of the four-quark model, the K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT state cannot decay via strong interactions into other two-meson channels. Therefore, the decay width of the bound state K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT can only originate from the process of K∗→K⁢π→superscript𝐾𝐾𝜋K^{*}\rightarrow K\piitalic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_K italic_π. Using the P03superscriptsubscript𝑃03{}^{3}P_{0}start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT model, we first calculated the decay width of the K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in vacuum based on previously fitted parameters of light mesons. Then, we calculated the decay width of the K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT when bound in the K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT state, taking into account the effects of binding energy. By comparing these two result, we estimated the decay width of the bound state K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Finally, We then employed the real-scaling method to systematically identify resonant states in the energy range of 1.4 GeV to 2.8 GeV and calculated their decay widths.

Due to symmetry restrictions, the molecular structure of the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system with 01+superscript0101^{+}01 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT involves four physical channels: two color singlets, K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and K∗⁢K∗superscript𝐾superscript𝐾K^{*}K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and their corresponding color octets. The energy of K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is 1393139313931393 MeV, which is 1 MeV above the threshold (1392139213921392 MeV). We performed channel coupling for these four molecular states. The results indicate that, although K∗⁢K∗superscript𝐾superscript𝐾K^{*}K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT exhibit strong attractive interactions, the coupling effect still do not lower the energy of the lowest energy channel K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT below the threshold. Similarly, due to symmetry constraints, the diquark structure contains only two physical channels, [s⁢s]60⁢[q¯⁢q¯]6¯1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠60superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯61[ss]_{6}^{0}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{6}}^{1}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 6 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 6 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and [s⁢s]31⁢[q¯⁢q¯]3¯0superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠31superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯30[ss]_{3}^{1}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{3}}^{0}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 3 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Subsequently, we performed structural mixing of the two physical channels in the diquark structure and the four physical channels in the molecular structure. The calculation results indicate that we obtained a bound state, B⁢(1320)𝐵1320B(1320)italic_B ( 1320 ), with a binding energy of 60 MeV. Similar to the decay width of Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which mainly comes from D⁢D∗→D⁢D+π→𝐷superscript𝐷𝐷𝐷𝜋DD^{*}\rightarrow DD+\piitalic_D italic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_D italic_D + italic_π, the decay width of the predicted bound state B⁢(1320)𝐵1320B(1320)italic_B ( 1320 ) should mainly result from K⁢K∗→K⁢K+π→𝐾superscript𝐾𝐾𝐾𝜋KK^{*}\rightarrow KK+\piitalic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_K italic_K + italic_π. Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has a binding energy of just 1111 MeV and hence only minimally affects the phase space for D⁢D∗→D⁢D+π→𝐷superscript𝐷𝐷𝐷𝜋DD^{*}\rightarrow DD+\piitalic_D italic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_D italic_D + italic_π, resulting in a decay width almost equal to that of D∗superscript𝐷D^{*}italic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. In contrast to Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, B⁢(1320)𝐵1320B(1320)italic_B ( 1320 ) has a binding energy of 60 MeV, which substantially reduces the phase space for K⁢K∗→K⁢K+π→𝐾superscript𝐾𝐾𝐾𝜋KK^{*}\rightarrow KK+\piitalic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_K italic_K + italic_π. As a result, the decay width of B⁢(1320)𝐵1320B(1320)italic_B ( 1320 ) is expected to be less than that of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. To estimate the decay width of the bound state in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system (K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT), we distribute the binding energy of 60606060 MeV equally between the two particles K𝐾Kitalic_K and K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The decay width of the K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, after this mass correction, provides the decay width of the bound state in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system (K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT). Employing the P03superscriptsubscript𝑃03{}^{3}P_{0}start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT model, we calculated the decay width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the decay width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT within the bound state K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT separately. The results are listed in Table 4. We observed that due to the influence of the binding energy, the decay width of the K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT decreased from 20202020 MeV to 17171717 MeV. Therefore, we believe that the width of the bound state B⁢(1320)𝐵1320B(1320)italic_B ( 1320 ) we obtained should be about 3 MeV smaller than the experimentally observed width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

V.2 Resonant-state calculation:

In the quark model, resonances can form through two kinds of mechanism: the first involves strong attraction between mesons, resulting in resonance states, and the second involves resonance formation due to attractive interactions between colorful structures. Since in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bound state calculations, every single channel is a scattering state, the first mechanism does not apply. Thus, we focus on identifying resonances under the second mechanism framework.

In the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system, there are four colorful structures: two diquark configurations, [s⁢s]60⁢[q¯⁢q¯]6¯1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠60superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯61[ss]_{6}^{0}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{6}}^{1}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 6 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 6 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and [s⁢s]31⁢[q¯⁢q¯]3¯0superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠31superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯30[ss]_{3}^{1}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{3}}^{0}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 3 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and two color-octet states, [K]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We first performed channel coupling of these four colorful structures. According to our calculations, within the energy range of 1.41.41.41.4-2.82.82.82.8 GeV, we identified 13 possible candidates of resonance in Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system. These resonances, denoted as E⁢(energy)𝐸energyE(\text{energy})italic_E ( energy ), are listed in Table 5 along with their corresponding color structure compositions. The majority of the candidates are situated around 2.6 GeV, indicating several genuine resonances at this energy level. Subsequently, we employed the real-scaling method to evaluate the stability of these resonances, with the results presented in FIG. 2. As shown in FIG. 2, most of the resonance candidates decayed into their corresponding threshold channels. Only four resonances, R⁢(2290)𝑅2290R(2290)italic_R ( 2290 ), R⁢(2610)𝑅2610R(2610)italic_R ( 2610 ), R⁢(2690)𝑅2690R(2690)italic_R ( 2690 ), and R⁢(2740)𝑅2740R(2740)italic_R ( 2740 ), survived the coupling process with the scattering channels. The resonance R⁢(2290)𝑅2290R(2290)italic_R ( 2290 ) primarily originates from the previous resonance candidate E⁢(2313)𝐸2313E(2313)italic_E ( 2313 ). As the scaling factor α𝛼\alphaitalic_α increased, the calculational space changed, causing the energy of E⁢(2313)𝐸2313E(2313)italic_E ( 2313 ) dropping to 2290229022902290 MeV, where it stabilized and formed an avoided crossing structure at α=1.2𝛼1.2\alpha=1.2italic_α = 1.2. Since the energies of most resonance candidates are concentrated around 2.6 GeV, we observe that the other three genuine resonances that survive after coupling with the scattering channels also have energies near 2.6 GeV. By comparing the energy levels, we can infer that resonance R⁢(2620)𝑅2620R(2620)italic_R ( 2620 ) likely originates from candidate E⁢(2618)𝐸2618E(2618)italic_E ( 2618 ), resonance R⁢(2680)𝑅2680R(2680)italic_R ( 2680 ) from candidate E⁢(2682)𝐸2682E(2682)italic_E ( 2682 ), and resonance R⁢(2740)𝑅2740R(2740)italic_R ( 2740 ) from candidate E⁢(2751)𝐸2751E(2751)italic_E ( 2751 ). We also calculated the percentage contributions of each channel and the root-mean-square distance between quarks for these resonances, as listed in Table 6. The table reveals that each resonance has a significant [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT component. From our previous bound state calculations, we have already analyzed that the energy of [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is lower than that of K∗⁢K∗superscript𝐾superscript𝐾K^{*}K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, indicating a strong attraction between [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since these four resonances contain substantial colorful structure components, their internal quark distances are small, within 1 fm. Additionally, their decay widths are all less than 10101010 MeV.

VI summary

In the framework of the chiral quark model, we systematically investigated the bound states and resonances of the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (s⁢q¯⁢s⁢q¯𝑠¯𝑞𝑠¯𝑞s\bar{q}s\bar{q}italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG italic_s over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG with 01+superscript0101^{+}01 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) system. Using the method of Gaussian expansion, we considered four physical channels, K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and K∗⁢K∗superscript𝐾superscript𝐾K^{*}K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and their corresponding color octets [K]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and [K∗]8⁢[K∗]8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝐾8[K^{*}]_{8}[K^{*}]_{8}[ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, in the molecular structure and two physical channels,[s⁢s]60⁢[q¯⁢q¯]6¯1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠60superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯61[ss]_{6}^{0}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{6}}^{1}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 6 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 6 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and [s⁢s]31⁢[q¯⁢q¯]3¯0superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]𝑠𝑠31superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]¯𝑞¯𝑞¯30[ss]_{3}^{1}[\bar{q}\bar{q}]_{\bar{3}}^{0}[ italic_s italic_s ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG over¯ start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over¯ start_ARG 3 end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, in the diquark structure, and performed a coupled-channel calculation of these two structures.

The bound state calculations reveal a deeply bound state, B⁢(1330)𝐵1330B(1330)italic_B ( 1330 ), with K⁢K∗𝐾superscript𝐾KK^{*}italic_K italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as its primary component. We propose that the main decay width of this bound state arises from the decay process K∗→K+π→superscript𝐾𝐾𝜋K^{*}\rightarrow K+\piitalic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_K + italic_π. Thus, using the P03superscriptsubscript𝑃03{}^{3}P_{0}start_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_FLOATSUPERSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT model, we calculated the decay width of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT as 20202020 MeV. However, the binding energy of B⁢(1330)𝐵1330B(1330)italic_B ( 1330 ), approximately 60606060 MeV, directly affects the decay phase space of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. By distributing this binding energy equally between K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and K𝐾Kitalic_K, we estimate that the energy of K∗superscript𝐾K^{*}italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT should be reduced by about 30303030 MeV during decay process. Consequently, the decay width of the bound state B⁢(1330)𝐵1330B(1330)italic_B ( 1330 ) in the Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system is estimated to be 17171717 MeV. Subsequently, we employed the real-scaling method to calculate the resonances. The results indicate that we obtained four resonances: R⁢(2290)𝑅2290R(2290)italic_R ( 2290 ), R⁢(2610)𝑅2610R(2610)italic_R ( 2610 ), R⁢(2690)𝑅2690R(2690)italic_R ( 2690 ), and R⁢(2740)𝑅2740R(2740)italic_R ( 2740 ), primarily composed of colorul structure components. Their decay widths are all within 10101010 MeV, and the internal quark distances are around 1111 fm.

Given the current interest in Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, with much attention focused on its heavy-flavor partner, there is limited research on the light-flavor partner of Tc⁢csubscript𝑇𝑐𝑐T_{cc}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, we suggest that related experiments be conducted to search for the predicted bound states and resonances in Ts⁢ssubscript𝑇𝑠𝑠T_{ss}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT system.
